verses.verse: Go<WG33> to now,<WG3568> you rich<WG4145> men, weep<WG2799> and howl<WG3649> for your<WG5216> miseries<WG5004> that shall come<WG1904> on you.
Your<WG5216> riches<WG4149> are corrupted,<WG4595> and your<WG5216> garments<WG2440> are moth-eaten.<WG4598>

Your<WG5216> gold<WG5557> and silver<WG696> is corroded;<WG2728> and the rust<WG2447> of them shall be a witness<WG3142> against you, and shall eat<WG5315> your<WG5216> flesh<WG4561> as it were fire.<WG4442> You have<WG2192> heaped<WG2343> treasure<WG2343> together for the last<WG2078> days.<WG2250>

Behold,<WG2400> the hire<WG3408> of the laborers<WG2040> who<WG3588> have<WG2192> reaped<WG270> down your<WG5216> fields,<WG5561> which<WG3588> is of you kept<WG650> back<WG650> by fraud,<WG650> cries:<WG2896> and the cries<WG995> of them which have<WG2192> reaped<WG2325> are entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the ears<WG3775> of the Lord<WG2962> of sabaoth.<WG4519>
You have lived<WG5171> in pleasure<WG5171> on<WG1909> the earth,<WG1093> and been wanton;<WG4684> you have nourished<WG5142> your<WG5216> hearts,<WG2588> as in a day<WG2250> of slaughter.<WG4967>
You have condemned<WG2613> and killed<WG5407> the just;<WG1342> and he does not resist<WG498> you.

Be patient<WG3114> therefore,<WG3767> brothers,<WG80> to the coming<WG3952> of the Lord.<WG2962> Behold,<WG2400> the farmer<WG1092> waits<WG1551> for the precious<WG5093> fruit<WG2590> of the earth,<WG1093> and has long<WG3114> patience<WG3114> for it, until<WG2193> he receive<WG2983> the early<WG4406> and latter<WG3797> rain.<WG5205>
Be you also<WG2532> patient;<WG3114> establish<WG4741> your<WG5216> hearts:<WG2588> for the coming<WG3952> of the Lord<WG2962> draws near.<WG1448>

Grudge<WG4727> not one<WG240> against<WG2596> another,<WG240> brothers,<WG80> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> you be condemned:<WG2632> behold,<WG2400> the judge<WG2923> stands<WG2476> before<WG4253> the door.<WG2374>

Take,<WG2983> my brothers,<WG80> the prophets,<WG4396> who<WG3739> have spoken<WG2980> in the name<WG3686> of the Lord,<WG2962> for an example<WG5262> of suffering<WG2552> affliction,<WG2552> and of patience.<WG3115>

Behold,<WG2400> we count<WG3106> them happy<WG3106> which endure.<WG5278> You have heard<WG191> of the patience<WG5281> of Job,<WG2492> and have seen<WG1492> the end<WG5056> of the Lord;<WG2962> that the Lord<WG2962> is very<WG4184> pitiful,<WG4184> and of tender<WG3629> mercy.<WG3629>

But above<WG4253> all<WG3956> things, my brothers,<WG80> swear<WG3660> not, neither<WG3383> by heaven,<WG3772> neither<WG3383> by the earth,<WG1093> neither<WG3383> by any<WG5100> other<WG243> oath:<WG3727> but let your<WG5216> yes<WG3483> be yes;<WG3483> and your<WG3588> no,<WG3756> no;<WG3756> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> you fall<WG4098> into<WG5259> condemnation.<WG5272>
Is any<WG5100> among<WG1722> you afflicted?<WG2553> let him pray.<WG4336> Is any<WG5100> merry?<WG2114> let him sing<WG5567> psalms.<WG5567>

Is any<WG5100> sick<WG770> among<WG1722> you? let him call<WG4341> for the elders<WG4245> of the church;<WG1577> and let them pray<WG4336> over<WG1909> him, anointing<WG218> him with oil<WG1637> in the name<WG3686> of the Lord:<WG2962>

And the prayer<WG2171> of faith<WG4102> shall save<WG4982> the sick,<WG2577> and the Lord<WG2962> shall raise<WG1453> him up; and if he have committed<WG4160> sins,<WG266> they shall be forgiven<WG863> him.

Confess<WG1843> your<WG3588> faults<WG3900> one<WG240> to another,<WG240> and pray<WG2172> one<WG240> for another,<WG240> that you may be healed.<WG2390> The effectual<WG1754> fervent prayer<WG1162> of a righteous<WG1342> man avails<WG2480> much.<WG4183>

Elias<WG2243> was a man<WG444> subject<WG3663> to like<WG3663> passions<WG3663> as we are, and he prayed<WG4336> earnestly<WG4335> that it might not rain:<WG1026> and it rained<WG1026> not on<WG1909> the earth<WG1093> by the space of three<WG5140> years<WG1763> and six<WG1803> months.<WG3376>
And he prayed<WG4336> again,<WG3825> and the heaven<WG3772> gave<WG1325> rain,<WG5205> and the earth<WG1093> brought<WG985> forth<WG985> her fruit.<WG2590>
Brothers,<WG80> if<WG1437> any<WG1536> of you do err<WG4105> from the truth,<WG225> and one<WG5100> convert<WG1994> him;

Let him know,<WG1097> that he which converts<WG1994> the sinner<WG268> from the error<WG4106> of his way<WG3598> shall save<WG4982> a soul<WG5590> from death,<WG2288> and shall hide<WG2572> a multitude<WG4128> of sins.<WG266>
